title: Font off of a make your own logo site
author: ChesM

comments.content:
Designed Hans Möhring as Gabriele for Wöllmer Type Foundry in 1938 or 1947. Here is a specimen from Weber, 1947, from Jaspert's \_Type Encyclopedia\_ [1970]:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213242im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Jaspert379Gabriele_4439.jpg)
  
The only digital version AFAIK is [Gabrielle](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213242/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/g/gabrielle.htm) -- note double l -- by Dieter Steffmann.  
The legitmacy of Steffmann's Gabrielle was discussed a couple of years ago: [http://typophile.com/node/87124](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020213242/http:/typophile.com/node/87124 "http://typophile.com/node/87124"). The consensus seems to have been that it is as "legitimate" as you're going to get.  
Don
